content: Linh Thi Xuan Phan's Home Page Linh Thi Xuan PHAN Professor University of Pennsylvania Computer and Information Science Department Levine 576 3330 Walnut Street, Philadelphia, PA 19104-6389 Phone:   +1 (215) 898-2012 Email:   linhphan AT cis.upenn.edu Teaching . Students . Honors & Awards . Publications . Service I am a professor at the University of Pennsylvania. My research interests include real-time, embedded systems, cyber-physical systems (CPS), distributed systems, robotics and security. I am especially interested in theoretical foundations and systems techniques for building cost-effective large-scale systems with provable safety, fault tolerance, security, and real-time performance. Recently, I have worked on compositional scheduling and analysis techniques, reliable real-time cloud infrastructure for safety-critical and mission-critical applications, the Internet of Things, and network function virtualization, as well as methods for diagnosing performance problems in data centers. Some of the projects I am currently working on include: efficient real-time fault tolerance techniques for distributed CPS, scalable adaptive resource allocation for modern hardware, computation-aware algorithmic design for CPS under uncertainty, fault detection, isolation and recovery strategies for distributed robotic systems, a new approach to defending cyber-physical systems and the cloud against security attacks, and a radically different architecture for large-scale data centers. I am a member of the PRECISE Center and the Distributed Systems Lab, and a co-director of the MSE in Data Science (DATS) program. I was previously a visiting researcher at Roblox Research. I am a recipient of the Lindback Award for Distinguished Teaching.
